title:
Tau polarization effects in $\nu_\tau / \bar{\nu}_\tau$-tungsten
  interactions at the LHC energies
authors: Reinaldo Francener, Victor P. Goncalves and Diego R. Gratieri
abstract:
Recent studies have demonstrated that the tau produced in charged current
neutrino deeply inelastic interactions at the GeV -- TeV neutrino energy range
is not fully polarized. In this paper we investigate the impact of the tau
polarization on the pions generated in its decay. In particular, we consider
tau neutrino - tungsten interactions at the LHC energies and estimate the
associated pion momentum, energy and angular distributions. The contribution of
the $F_5$ is also investigated. Our results indicate that the pion properties
are sensitive to the tau polarization state as well as to the magnitude of
$F_5$.
